Netizen contribution
The famous Nintendo game "Animal Crossing: New Horizons" has opened the "Korean New Year Red Packet", which has triggered protests from Chinese players.
I personally find it strange that I have never heard of the term "Korean New Year" in previous years. Why is it that this year, there is suddenly a lot of publicity about "Korean New Year" everywhere?

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Today in Sanmenxia, Henan, tourists who were taking photos and playing in the middle of the river were washed away due to the sudden release of water from the dam.
Eyewitnesses said that because the incident happened suddenly, the river water rose by nearly one meter in a few minutes, and it was too late for many people to react.
The official report currently states that the incident has caused two deaths and seven people are missing.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Correction: January 22

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Case report

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Another netizen said that the Sanmenxia Dam releases water automatically, and there are guardrails and "No Crossing" warning signs on both sides of the river, but tourists still go into the water without permission all year round.
Before the incident, the riverbed was dry, so many people went down to take pictures.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, a video accusing the domestic "Internet addiction school" "Yashengsi" education base in Yaojia Town, Zhongmu County, Zhengzhou, Henan Province of abusing minors has once again attracted public attention.
In the video, the author recounted his experiences in the school, and the content was so exaggerated and terrifying that it was jaw-dropping.
The original up uploaded another video exposing the institution on station B, which was 37 minutes long, but was quickly deleted and his personal safety was also threatened

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: As a generation that has experienced the "Internet addiction war", I have seen too much in the past ten years. I hope that all parents understand that the so-called "special training schools" and "Internet addiction schools" have no effect. They just torture your children into a stressed, numb, and self-defeating puppet through concentration camp-style high-pressure management. In the end, you just get a doll that you can control again, if that's what you want.
